channel.title: Air on chapter31
channel.description: Recent content in Air on chapter31

item.title: mooFlair on Adobe's top 10 list
item.description: Areez Gangji has just posted on Adobe devnet an article listing the “Top 10 Adobe Flex and AIR applications for students”. I’m very proud to say that a good friend (and fellow Daemon alumni) Patrick Tai has an app on their called mooFlair which he originally built for the AIR derby. What is mooFlair? A desktop application that helps you to manage and watch both online and offline FLVs videos.

item.title: cfdocs on air (livedocs for CF8)
item.description: Brian Love recently released an AIR application he wrote which wraps up the ColdFusion 8 ‘livedocs’. This is a great idea and a fantastic tool to add to your list. I’m sure most developers use livedocs as a reference (I do all the time) but historically the are SO slow (not to mention that I think Adobe needs to invest in a little SEO as I often get CF6 livedocs at the top of Google results!

item.title: Google analytics AIR app
item.description: An interesting AIR app has been released in Beta for Google analytics. From the author: The Google Analytics Reporting suite is an Adobe AIR application that brings Google Analytics to the desktop. It uses itâ€™s own custom API to interact with Google and nearly implements all features of Analytics. You can even export the data to PDF, XLS (Excel) and XML. Nice :)
